title: Genital Herpes Resources
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

content: The following genital herpes resources will help you locate more health information, referrals to clinics and clinical trials , hotlines, support groups, and more.

content_blocks.text: The following genital herpes resources will help you locate more health information, referrals to clinics and clinical trials , hotlines, support groups, and more.

sections.heading: Genital Herpes Information
content: The website of the CDC's STD division has statistics galore, plus fact sheets and links to other public health resources such as local and state health departments. The CDC also operates the National STD Hotline. Specialists at the hotline answer questions, provide referrals to clinics, and will send printed materials.
bullets: American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists www.acog.org They make educational pamphlets available to members so check with your doctor to see what is available.
CDC Division of Sexually Transmitted Diseases www.cdc.gov/std CDC National STD Hotline English/Spanish (800) 232-4636 TTY: (888) 232-6348

The National Institutes of Health, ClinicalTrials.gov www.clinicaltrials.gov ClinicalTrials.gov is a service of the National Institutes of Health. You can search the website for clinical trials that are looking for patients to sign up. The database includes studies sponsored by government agencies, drug companies, universities, and other organizations.

sections.heading: Genital Herpes Support
bullets: American Social Health Association www.ashastd.org ASHA National S TD Hotline (919) 361-8488 Among the many herpes resources compiled by the American Social Health Association are links to contact information for support groups. Another ASHA website, www.iwannaknow.org , provides sexual health information written specifically for teens.
